sentence.text: Ribosome profiling and RNA sequencing identified membrane protein proteolysis as a principle node for gene expression regulation downstream from miRNA catabolic process In vitro and in vivo data demonstrate that epithelial IMP1 loss increases expression of WNT target genes and enhances LIN28B-mediated intestinal tumorigenesis, which was reversed when we overexpressed IMP1 independently in vivo.

Together, our data provide new evidence for the opposing effects of the miRNA catabolic process-membrane protein proteolysis axis on post-transcriptional regulation of canonical WNT signaling, with implications in intestinal homeostasis, regeneration and tumorigenesis
